Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: truello
Reviews.Content: I was simply looking for a place to lay horizontally while looking for an apartment after my cross country drive to Seattle. I thought I would be here longer than 5 days so I wanted a cheap rate, knowing that there would be some issues. I was pleasantly surprised by this place. The only issues I really had were a faint smoke smell in the non-smoking room (I blame the person next-door who I saw smoking out the window of his non-smoking room a couple of days later), and some cigarette burns in the comforter. I don't really understand why you wouldn't replace a comforter that has several holes from cigarette burns, they can't be that expensive. Anyway none of the above is news if you've read any of the other reviews. I just wanted to write on here to say that Jessie from the staff was super friendly and very helpful. He is the sole reason this is 3 stars instead of 2.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Ballardgal50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days while our floors were being refinished. The room was clean and the bed, while a little hard, was comfortable. We also had our dog with us, and they had plenty of grass areas for her. We heard no noise at all from our room, which made for a good nights sleep. For the price, I feel this was a great choice for us! They even let us check in 3 hrs early since the contractors kicked us out of our house! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap But Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Joann G
Reviews.Content: Upon walking into the room I was over whelmed with a strong perfume odor. After opening windows and using the fan it finally was bearable. The bed is "rock" hard -- I actually thought they forgot to put the mattress on top of the box spring. The shower has a water restriction head that produces a mist of water -- no adjustment on the shower head. The bath tub is narrow and not useable by an over weight guest. The hotel/room is clean but I would not give this hotel a thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: dougers79
Reviews.Content: Relocating to a different state can be hard. Finding the right area to live in and the right place is even harder. The last thing you need is to worry about your temporary "place". I got very lucky!!!!! I have read reviews about this property and I am confused. I thought the staff was AMAZING!! Every single one of them. The Manager Brittney genuinely cares about the property, guests and staff. If you are relocating to the area and need something temporary...I cannot think of a better place. Are there smells in the hall?? Yes...there are. When each room has a kitchen...you are bound to have food odor come into the hall. I never smelled smoke. If you ask for the first floor...you are far away from the smoking floor. Some of the rooms are remodled. I was in one. Room 138. Great room! The area is fine. You have a gym, grocery store, kmart, restaurants and starbucks all within walking distance. The bus stop is only a block away. I didn't see anyone anymore sketchy than you would see in any other part of the city. It is no frills...but the rooms are clean, well appointed and the staff is great. My boss stayed here while in town and she is VERY picky...she was in an older smoking room and she did not have any complaints. My ONE complaint is that the wifi is slow but it works. So with all of this...I would strongly reccomend this hotel for anyone needing a place for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: tabitha1983
Reviews.Content: i saw really good reviews on this hotel from priceline.com and boy was i fooled. check in time was suppose to be 3pm. we get there after 3, are given our keys but told to come back because they weren't even close to cleaning our room. then we are told that we are in a smoking room even though i asked for non smoking when making the reservation. we leave and tour seattle, have dinner and make our way to the hotel again around 9pm. we get up to our room only to find out the door lock on top was busted previously and was using a carbiner and paperclip to keep it in place. it smelled absolutely terrible, the window was broken so you couldn't open it. the tv remote didn't work for anything and the volume wouldn't go past a certain point on the tv which made it hard to hear it. the bed was so hard and uncomfortable and there were cigarette holes in the chair, bed, sheets and comforters. the day of checkout, we were getting ready to check out by 12pm (which is what the checkout time was) and at 11 am, the maintenance man came to our room and asked if we were leaving yet, then 20 mins later, the cleaning staff shows up to clean our room. we weren't even given til checkout time before being harassed about checking out. i have stayed at a hotel owned by extended stay before and it was great, but this was the worst experience i have ever had with a hotel. never again will i stay at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!!”
Reviews.Author: twinsmom2006
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was terrible!!! To begin with I had made a reservation for a double non smoking over the phone, when I went to check in they had me in a double smoking!! They let me go smell the room and the stench of old cigarettes mixed with Indian food was too much to bear. They then proceeded to "find" me another room even though they were "totally booked!!" The beds are harder than rocks, staff is not very friendly and they are also fairly incompetent as they don't even know who is staying in their rooms. When a relative who had been there for 6 days with me went to check out they didn't even have her in that room and didn't know what to charge her.

Reviews.Title: “A Carnival of SMELLS”
Reviews.Author: bartolino
Reviews.Content: First about me: I am a budget hotel type of person, always looking for a good deal and not too picky. I am not the hotel snob type, but have to report something when it comes up. This hotel is one that did not make the cut. Got a good deal online, $45 + tax (go online and book thru the hotel website with code ESH10 promo code) Had to haggle with the guy about the promo code, and ended up having to show him a pdf saved on my iphone. The kid behind the counter was pretty uninformed about most topics. The room was on the 3rd floor near the elevator. The room itself is pretty basic - small basic kitchen. standard bathroom - Queen bed (average firmness, cheap sheets, but clean) very small TV, small kind of dirty chair. The first thing you notice in the hallway is a "Fish" smell. My hunch is some of the people staying here are cooking some smelly things. The room has a smell of cigarettes, even though it's supposed to be non-smoking. IT COMES THROUGH THE VENTILATION SYSTEM. I could smell smokey smells wafting through the vent near the front door. Lastly, the bed cover had an "Old sweaty man" smell that was not very nice. 3 distinctive bad smells were pretty bad. Other than the smells, the hotel is pretty average. Some kind of sketchy people were hanging out in the front part of the parking lot messing with some old windowless van. I made sure to park my car near the front entrance of the hotel. Overall, if your looking for a rock bottom deal, and can handle some pretty foul odors...go for it. Personally, I will look for a better hotel next time I come to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience I have ever had- Read this before you book”
Reviews.Author: TravelgirlNC84
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to share that I am a mellow person and not picky about much at hotels. I have never written a hotel review before, but I felt obligated to do so because I had such a bad experience. I had to stay here because I was coming to a workshop that was within walking distance, but if I ever come back I will make sure to stay elsewhere and take the bus. The front desk service and management were horrible. My roommate and I made them aware of all of the issues I will list below, ended up calling corporate, and had to beg to get any response, apology or compensation. We arrived and they had cancelled our entire room block. They said it was full and then magically found us a room half hour later (and about 20 others who had been cancelled too). However, my roommate and I had to switch rooms 3 times in the first day of arrival and stayed in a single when we booked a double- which we were charged for and had to ask twice just to take the $10 off the rate for staying in a single. Everything smells like smoke. We booked a non-smoking room, and the last straw was when my roommate walked into the room into a fresh cloud of smoke. Our once-a-week cleaning had been done and the AC messed with so obviously the housekeepers had been smoking in our room while working. Disgusting since I am allergic. There was no toilet paper available for an entire week. We asked for more and their response was that they had already been to the Cash-n-Carry twice that day. We had to provide our own for our first week there. My roommate asked for a washcloth and was handed a raggedy dishcloth for her face because she was told they were out. We were in Seattle during the record breaking heatwave and our AC did not work- only the fan and would cut off without warning. The front desk's response was that the mantenience man was in the hospital. Our fridge leaked on the inside and got all of our food wet. Half of the washers in the laundry room were out of order our first week of the stay. We asked for a bus map or any information about the closest bus stop and they couldn't help us. We were told we would be charged half our stay the first week and the rest upon checkout, however, they charged the entire stay to my credit card early. I could go on and on about these issues and the worst part is that not one person seemed to care- from the front desk all the way to corporate. We called numerous people and were disconnected, put on hold, connected to other managers who could do nothing, and were told we would be called back and we never got a response. I knew someone who stayed here the previous summer and had an issue with bed bugs and she said the management didn't seem to care then, so I should have been warned but gave it the benefit of the doubt. Please don't go here if you expect any kind of normal hotel service or necessities because they won't provide it. Absolutely the most ridiculous hotel experience I have ever had. Other helpful info: Aurora Ave. is sketchy, especially at night- which is the main road outside the hotel. There are a few places outside the hotel within walking distance that are good to visit, like Albertson's grocery across the street and a yogurt place called Melon in the same shopping area. There are not too many restaurants within walking distance other than a fast seafood place (good service there- I think it's called Ivan's or Ivar's?), an Outback, and a Starbucks on Aurora. The 358 bus on Aurora will take you downtown Seattle, which is a much better experience than this area. This bus can be a little sketchy, so only take it during the day if you are solo. Another fun place to catch a bus to is Green Lake Park, which is not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: vanwinkle50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting family that lived near by. The room seemed quite clean, the only mark I'd put against the housekeeping was that they forgot to empty the trash under the sink from the previous visitor. We had no problems with the management. There was plenty of free open parking spaces. The room was very quiet at night, we were surprised. We got it at a really cheap rate (with an online coupon) so it was a really good value for us.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent management & gross housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: IowaGirl52
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely mediocre hotel. If you can book a room through Priceline, it might be worth it but it is NOT worth paying the regular rate. I stayed there for a month while in town on business and saw police cars there almost 3 times a week. Very sketchy. Several of people working at the front desk at night were very nice, but the management during the day was grossly incompetent -- and not all that friendly. The room was okay but if you are a non-smoker, be aware that the entire property smells like smoke. Housekeeping is not reliable. I saw one of the housekeepers wipe down a kitchen counter AFTER they had used the same cloth to wipe the floor (GROSS). I will stay there again if my company requires me to do so, but first I will beg them to find another option.

Reviews.Title: “Kitchen for Young Couples”
Reviews.Author: HappinessResearcher
Reviews.Content: I recommend for couples who don't have chance to cook together for some reason. I only stayed overnight, but I could easily imagine how fun it would be to live with my girlfriend in some future. So I didn't need a lot of things like hotel freaks, sorry not negative, think they need; we only needed some time and space for us:)

Reviews.Title: “Distended Stay”
Reviews.Author: danaisagirl
Reviews.Content: Ah yes, our first experience booking with priceline brought us way out to Extended Stay Seattle: land of dirty bathrooms, harsh lighting, uncomfortable beds, and questionable internet access. While we did take hearty advantage of Extended Stay's pros during our visit (in-room refrigerator, friendly staff), many of its cons made us wish for a room closer to the city. The neighborhood didn't seem too sketchy...just a lot more suburban than we expected. The hotel itself, however, did have some interesting creations of humanity crawling around outside of it. Not a terrible stay...very basic and we got what we paid for...but I'd love to have stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet and friendly place to stay for short or long term”
Reviews.Author: Expat_American
Reviews.Content: I used to live in this neighborhood and was glad to find another nice hotel in the area off of the main road. I got this place for $55 a night from priceline and was rewarded with a friendly front desk staff even at 8pm at night. It was my second time staying with Extended Stay for a short term stay and I was not disappointed. The area offers a Albertsons just a short walk from the facility. There is a Kmart there as well. It is about a 5 minute walk to these stores. The facility is located one street off of busy/noisy Aurora Ave. and is well insulated from the road noise with the shopping center in front of it. This is a new facility and everything was top of the line. The rooms are big enough to hold 4 suitcases and 4 carry on's. The bed is a bit hard to my liking, but it was comfortable. You need extra pillows? No problem. The shower was outstanding and the bathroom was large. The kitchen area was perfect. Watch out though if you use the coffee maker, you need to put that on the stove or you will burn the counter top. Someone did that before I was there. There are bellman carts available in the laundry vending area during office hours. If you have a early check out you will have to take your luggage out piece by piece. That is the only downside to these places. 5 Stars to this place if you want a quiet apartment type of place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: traveller20074
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience there. Friday night I had a very noisy neighbor. I tolerated it for a while, then went down on my way to dinner and said something. He said he'd call..and that was it for the noise. VERY courteous front desk. Was very clean and seemed like the other person said, like a little furnished apartment. LOVED the recliner! ALL motels should have one. Very comfortable to watch television. usually, it's very difficult to get comfortable on a bed or the chairs provided that don't have backs. As it was said, there was no dishsoap..not a problem, since I didn't cook there. Wasn't there long enough to think about it. I'm not one to HAVE to have the hand cream, shampoo, etc. I bring my own, anyway. I would stay again in a heartbeat, and WILL stay there again if I'm in the area. I was very pleased with Priceline as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value ~ Clean”
Reviews.Author: OlympicPenResident
Reviews.Content: Excellent price and value for longer stays in North Seattle. I write this review to share my experience, so that others can come "prepared". When I travel, I typically prefer to stay in higher end accommodations (Hotel Andra, Hyatt, Westin) in Seattle. Since I had a longer stay in North Seattle, I choose ExtendedStay to save money. I was pleasantly surprised with what I found. The room was clean and had everything I needed â€“ a bed, bathroom, kitchen, towels, iron, tv, and wireless! I felt it was a bit like renting a small, furnished apartment. I can see where people might be surprised with the lack of typical conveniences, so it is important to bring: shampoo, conditioner, hairdryer, lotion, and kitchen dish soap. If you are prepared, then the stay is GREAT for the value with a kitchen. I had to think hard about an inconvenience â€“ the only one I could think of is the smell of burnt popcorn in the evening from another room. Enjoy your time in Seattle â€“ wherever your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: hmsbaby
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the cheapest hotel I have ever stayed at. Where do I start? First off, I am paying $73 per night (5 nights total) which is a good price but not what I consider a no frills price. At that price I expect a typical 2-3 star hotel experience. This is not included here! What is missing: No maid service unless you stay more than 7 nights! (or pay $5 more for it), no breakfast (unless you count coffee in the lobby), no pool, no hair dryer (unless you go downstairs and sign one out!), no shampoo (only two tiny bars of soap), only one coffee bag for the whole stay!!, and no hangers in the closet. In addition, they treat their customers like they don't trust them for a second. They charge your credit card for the whole stay on the first night. When I called down to get the wireless password (which is the very reasonable cost of $5), they asked me to come down stairs and sign the credit card receipt. Are you kidding me? How ridiculous can you get. The only positive thing I can say is the hotel is very clean and seems newly constructed. It is also off the main drag and very quiet. Overall my experience is very negative. In fact I am writing this as I am staying at the hotel. I have NEVER done this before! I think this hotel concept is ok if the price was considerably lower and all the items are stated up front so you know what you need to bring w/ you. I was taken completely by surprise (w/ the exception of the maid service which is noted on their website). Be forewarned before you stay at this hotel!!

HotelInfo.Name: Extended StayAmerica Seattle Northgate
HotelInfo.Address: 13300 Stone Ave N, Seattle, WA 98133
